inventory.commentary: No VPC for this verb Groups 2 and 4 don't have a propbank roleset

sense.name: hand out, dispense or dole out something
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] DISTRIBUTE NP2[patient] PP[recipient] Note: the act of distribution is intentional or purposive
sense.examples: Bottles of water and blankets were distributed to the evacuees. This year the company is distributing a dividend to each shareholder. The TA will be distributing the final exam tomorrow in Room 210.

sense.name: spread or scatter over an area or region
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] DISTRIBUTE NP2[patient] Note: The distribution is not intentional or purposive, no recipient
sense.examples: Layers of ash were distributed here millions of years ago by a volcano. Portuguese became distributed around the world by 17th century sailors. This function distributes the values along a straight line. A probability function distributes a probability mass of 1 throughout the sample space.

sense.name: circulate or publicize something
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[instrument] DISTRIBUTE NP2[patient] (PP) NP1[instrument] DISTRIBUTE NP2[patient] (ADVP)
sense.examples: This film has not yet been distributed overseas. The students had a petition distributed to the faculty last week. The rumor of John's resignation was widely distributed before he could stop it.

sense.name: arrange items or be arranged
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1 DISTRIBUTE NP2[goal] ADVP
sense.examples: Distribute the cards so that there are three in each group. The gardener had distributed the bulbs to form a circle around the tree. In the expression 'a(b + c)' multiplication can also distribute 'a' over both 'b' and 'c' as 'ab + ac'.
